snippet: A drug that in theory should have killed a cancer patient instead seemed to have halted or even reversed her disease.
abstract: Whole genome sequencing is a new method of identifying cancer treatments based on the idea that many cancers differ from patient to patient, and may have different genetic causes; Beth McDaniel, who suffered from blood cell cancer, gambled on whole genome sequencing which led her doctors to give her an expensive drug approved for melanoma patients; in theory, the drug should have killed her; instead, it seemed to have halted or even reversed her cancer (Series: Genetic Gamble).
lead_paragraph: A drug that in theory should have killed a cancer patient instead seemed to have halted or even reversed her disease.

headline.seo: New Frontiers of Cancer Treatment Bring Breathtaking Swings
headline.main: A New Treatment’s Tantalizing Promise Brings Heartbreaking Ups and Downs
